All Classes

Class Description
AntiBug
represents a helping bug that has a light attached and random movement
AppPreferences
"static" class that gives access to the settings made by the user
Assets
manages all the assets with easy access due to AssetDescriptors
BackgroundMusic
represents the backgroundmusic of the actual game session including the ability to play, loop, pause and stop the musicstream It is also possible to adjust the volume and use a stuttering effect
BitSavior
entry point from Desktop launcher creates a screen manager and loads title screen
Bug
represents an enemy including A.I is a MovingEntity for the movement behaviour and implements a collision interface
DesktopLauncher
entry point for the application
EnemyAI
positronic brain!
Entity
represents a basic entity that can exist in the world.
Environment
handles the lights in the scene including positioning of the lighted objects
GameScreen
Screen which displays the game itself
GameState
represents the actual state of the game used for flow control of the application
ICollision
Interface for collision detection between two Entities
LightedEntity
a lighted entity contains functionality for manipulating lightsources and display visual effects
LightedEntity.EffectType
represents a type of effect for the lightsource
LightSource
represents a light source in the game works with textures and alphablending
LightSource.TYPE
represents the huetype of the lightsource
LoseScreen
Screen which is shown after a loss
Movement
represents the current movement direction of a moving entity
MovingEntity
a moving entity controls the moving behaviour and the moving animations.
PickUp
a pickup that can be collected
Player
represents the Player including functionality for collecting of pickups and extends a moving entity
ScreenManager
This Class holds and manages the Screens
Screens
Enum for easier Screen switching
SettingsScreen
Screen for the user to adjust settings
SoundEffect
a sound effect.
Tilemap
represents the map of the game and all related data and renderer
TitleScreen
Main menu and first screen which is shown
TutorialScreen
Screen which is shown before a level 1
UserInterface
holds all data related to the user interface during a game session
Watch
a watch holds information and functionality for implementing timers e.g for controlling time sensitive behaviours and effect changes
WinScreen
Screen which is shown after a win
World
the main class of the game
WorldBounds
static class for the constant worldbounds
